title: Drawing a red card
text: A standard deck contains an equal number of hearts, diamonds, clubs, and spades. Hearts and diamonds are both the only red cards. So the probability of drawing a red card is $$\frac{1}{2}$$.

title: Drawing an ace
text: There are four aces in a standard deck, and there are a total of 52 cards. So the probability of drawing an ace is $$\frac{4}{52}$$ or $$\frac{1}{13}$$.

title: Drawing a red card and an ace
text: The only two cards in the deck that is both a red card and an ace is the ace of hearts and the ace of diamonds, so the probability of drawing both a red card and an ace is $$\frac{2}{52}$$ or $$\frac{1}{26}$$.

title: Probability of the Union of Two Events
text: Add the probablity of drawing a red card and the probablity of drawing an ace. Subtract the probability of drawing a card that is both a red card and an ace.
